metadata.title: Epstein Island
metadata.subtitle: An island drifting between Excess and Restraint
metadata.summary: Manage a private island founded as a sanctuary of absolute freedom. Balance between unchecked indulgence and reactionary moral order without collapsing into sterility or overload.
metadata.victoryCondition: Sustain social tension without allowing total indulgence or total repression.
collapseConditions: Excess collapse: the island loses structure under overwhelming indulgence and overstimulation.
Restraint collapse: moral regulation sterilizes social life and erases spontaneity.

motifs.name: Open Indulgence
motifs.description: Public celebration of desire and unrestricted expression.

motifs.name: Moral Regulation
motifs.description: Committees, dress codes, and formalized limits on behavior.

motifs.name: Eroded Privacy
motifs.description: Personal boundaries dissolve as public life expands.

motifs.name: Ritualized Modesty
motifs.description: Formality replaces spontaneity in social interactions.

cards.text: A 24-hour beach gathering becomes permanent.
Private villas begin hosting open-door celebrations.
Dress expectations are lifted across the island.
Public displays of affection become normalized.
Music is allowed to continue through the night.
A festival of uninhibited expression is announced.
The central pavilion hosts continuous performances.
Beach bonfires become nightly tradition.
Guests are encouraged to abandon formal identities.
Privacy screens are removed from common areas.
Some guests quietly request secluded spaces.
A proposal for voluntary quiet hours circulates.
Whispers of discomfort spread among residents.
Certain villas begin restricting entry to invitation only.
Temporary partitions appear in shared areas.
A debate over boundaries divides the island.
Morning gatherings replace late-night events in some districts.
A suggestion box for concerns is installed.
Some guests begin dressing more conservatively.
Security presence subtly increases.
A voluntary code of conduct is drafted.
Late-night gatherings require registration.
Designated hours of silence are announced.
A committee for island decorum is formed.
Certain areas are marked as reserved and private.
A modest dress advisory is issued.
Night events must conclude before dawn.
Beach access is limited to specific hours.
A registry of visitors is introduced.
Public gatherings require prior approval.
Power briefly fails during a crowded evening event.
Archived footage from early island days is erased.
An island-wide day of silence is declared.
The slogan 'Freedom Without Limits' disappears overnight.
Guests are asked to reflect publicly on boundaries.
The oceanfront pavilion closes temporarily for restructuring.

A confidential letter circulates questioning the island’s purpose.
An early founder returns to address the community.
